thread.title: Kutztown University band to march in Philadelphia Thanksgiving parade
thread.title_full: Kutztown University band to march in Philadelphia Thanksgiving parade - The Morning Call

author: mcall.com
title: Kutztown University band to march in Philadelphia Thanksgiving parade
text:
The Kutztown University Marching Unit has been chosen as one of 17 bands to appear in the 2015 Philadelphia Thanksgiving Day Parade to be broadcast on ABC 6.
The Kutztown University unit is one of only two bands from Pennsylvania in the parade and the only college band.
The other Pennsylvania band is Pennsbury High School Marching Band from Bucks County.
KUMU is made up of 150 members in brass, percussion and color guard. The band provides music, marching, and entertainment for all KU Golden Bears home football games, select away games, marching band festivals/competitions, professional sporting events, parades, and activities.
Now in its 96th year, the Philadelphia Thanksgiving Day Parade is the oldest Thanksgiving parade in the nation. The 1.4-mile parade route ends at the Philadelphia Museum of Art.
The parade will be telecast locally by 6 ABC at 8:30 a.m. Thanksgiving Day. It also vcan be viewed in a live webcast at www.6abc.com.
Other bands appearing are Jackson Memorial High School Marching Band of New Jersey; A.I. DuPont High School Marching Band of Delaware; Silver Bluff-Midland Valley High School Marching Band of South Carolina; Woodland High School Marching Band of Georgia; Riverview High School Marching Band of Florida; Alan B. Shepard High School Marching Band of Illinois; Evansville Vanderburgh School Corp All-Star Marching Band, Fishers High School Tiger Band, LaPorte High School Marching Band and Pendleton Heights Marching Arabians Marching Band, all of Indiana; Oneonta High School Marching Band and Smiths Station High School Panther Spirit Marching Band of Alabama; Thunder Squad Drumline of California; Heights Youth Club Marching Band of Jamaica, and Tournament of Bands All Star Marching Band, featuring students from 14 states.
